title: kerala Maternity Benefits:Kerala Becomes The First State To Extend Maternity Benefits To Private Education Sector, Women Employees Can Now Avail 26 Weeks Paid Leaves
text:
In a significant move that could benefit thousands of teachers and other employees in the private education institutions, Kerala has decided to implement maternity benefits to the sector.

The Central Government has approved the Kerala Government’s decision to bring these teachers and employees under the Maternity Benefit Act.

REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE

The Kerala Government had in August decided to approach the Centre to issue a notification in this regard.

Once implemented, Kerala will become the first state in the country to provide maternity benefits in the private educational sector.

Thousands of employees in the private education sector in the state can also avail the 26 weeks' maternity leave with salary as guaranteed in the Act like government employees.

The employer also has to provide Rs 1,000 to meet their medical expenses, it said.

REPRESENTATIONAL IMAGE

"It is for the first time that a state government in the country is bringing the private education sector under the ambit of the Maternity Benefit Act," the release said adding the state government has already been going ahead with steps to ensure minimum wages to teachers in the unaided sector.

"This is a historic decision which will include teachers of unaided schools under the ambit of the Maternity Benefit Act. This is the first such decision in the country," Kerala Labour Minister TP Ramakrishnan said in a Facebook post.

Earlier this year, in another progressive move the Kerala government had proposed about paid menstrual leave for government employees. A final decision on this is yet to be taken. Some private firms in the state are already providing period leave' for women employees.
